supplementaryNotes.content: The use of the word frog to mean “a French person” is a slur that arose because the French were stereotypically thought of as eating frogs.

source.author: Jonathan Lambert
source.title: Water beetles can live on after being eaten and excreted by a frog

exampleSentences.sentence: I was expecting that the frogs might just spit out the beetles or something.

source.author: Christie Wilcox
source.title: Bizarre caecilians may be the only amphibians with venomous bites

exampleSentences.sentence: Caecilians are amphibians like salamanders and frogs, but they’re often mistaken for snakes because of their long, legless bodies.

source.author: Erin Garcia de Jesus
source.title: Toxic germs on its skin make this newt deadly

exampleSentences.sentence: So does the blue-ringed octopus, some crabs and starfish, not to mention certain flatworms, frogs and toads.

source.author: Emily Conover
source.title: Physicists foil classic oobleck science trick

exampleSentences.sentence: For instance, ketchup and frog saliva both get thinner when force is applied to them.

source.author: Erin Garcia de Jesus
source.title: Lots of frogs and salamanders have a secret glow

exampleSentences.sentence: Fluorescence may help salamanders and frogs find one another in low light.
A was an Archer, who shot at a frog; B was a Butcher, and had a great dog.

source.title: Boys and Girls Bookshelf; a Practical Plan of Character Building, Volume I (of 17)
source.author: Various

exampleSentences.sentence: He looked over his shoulder at Matt, then promptly jumped into the rocks and started for Frog Tanks cross-lots.
When they had toiled up the bank to a level stretch, he let the roadster out, and they went through Frog Tanks like a red streak.
Yet, be that as it might, both men vanished from Frog Tanks and were never afterward located.
His face was, moreover, mottled with dusky spots, so that he reminded the spectator of a frog or a toad.
